items.title: New report tells us when the Samsung Galaxy Watch Ultra 2 is coming
items.summary: Samsung launched the Galaxy Watch Ultra in 2024 and then followed it up this year with the Galaxy Watch Ultra 2025, which is just a different colorway. So with this in mind, you may have been wondering when to expect the real Galaxy Watch Ultra 2 to show up. According to a new report, the answer isâ€¦

items.title: VAR corner checks won't cause delays - referee boss Collina

items.title: Microsoft is quietly walking back its diversity efforts
items.summary: Microsoft has been publishing data about the gender, race, and ethnic breakdown of its employees for more than a decade. Since 2019 it's been publishing a full diversity and inclusion report annually, and at the same time made reporting on diversity a requirement for employee performance reviews. Nâ€¦

The images it generates are so realistic it's bananas. I feel like I'm going banaâ€¦

items.title: Wiffen leaves it late to win stunning 1500m gold
items.summary: Daniel Wiffen puts in a late surge to retain his 1500m freestyle title in a thrilling final at the European Short Course Swimming Championships.

items.title: Wiffen wins stunning 1500m gold as McMillan takes 200m silver
items.summary: Daniel Wiffen puts in a late surge to retain his 1500m freestyle title in a thrilling final at the European Short Course Swimming Championships.

items.title: 'I am a leader, not a boss' - Celtic's Nancy sets out his plans

items.title: Upcoming AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D has 120W TDP,  leaked shipping manifest states â€” Zen 5 X3D refresh will maintain the same power draw as 9800X3D
items.summary: AMD is refreshing its X3D lineup, with new chips part of the Ryzen 9000 family, one of which is the updated Ryzen 7 9850X3D. As the name suggests, it's pretty much the same as the existing 9800X3D, but with 400 MHz higher boost clocks, which have now been confirmed won't require more power.

items.title: Report says iPhone Air is losing its resale value at a record pace
items.summary: The iPhone Air is shaping up to be a sales flop, and thatâ€™s also translating to its resale value. A new report from SellCell analyzed the depreciation of the iPhone 17 series based on trade-in price data from over 40 US-based buyback companies over a ten-week period. Based on the data, the Air has â€¦

items.title: Usyk can make voluntary defence v Wilder - WBC
items.summary: Oleksandr Usyk has permission to face Deontay Wilder next in a voluntary defence of his WBC heavyweight title.

items.title: From out-shining Palmer to a new start and FA Cup joy at Buxton
items.summary: Tai Sodje outscored Cole Palmer as Manchester City teenagers, now at 22 he is building his senior career at non-league FA Cup hopefuls Buxton.

items.title: Hislop being treated for aggressive prostate cancer
items.summary: Former Premier League goalkeeper Shaka Hislop says he has an aggressive form of prostate cancer, and urges men of Caribbean heritage to get tested for the disease.

items.title: Horror movie character? 'I don't waste my time on that' - Verstappen in-depth on title race
items.summary: Max Verstappen looks forward to the F1 title showdown in Abu Dhabi, acknowledges that he is probably in his rivals' heads and discusses his intense competitiveness.

items.title: 'I've never met anyone like Pollock' - George on England's 'brilliant idiot'
items.summary: Jamie George says England team-mate Henry Pollock is a personality without precedent in rugby and a "genuinely fascinating" character.

items.title: Joshua on weight for Paul fight as undercard confirmed
items.summary: Anthony Joshua is on weight for his heavyweight fight with Jake Paul later this month.

items.title: 'No more Average Joe as Root century seals all-time great status'
items.summary: Joe Root finally hitting the elusive Test century in Australia proves his status as one of the all-time great batters, says chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt.

While the company hasnâ€™t revealed any details about the phone yet, the stream of leaks continues. New spy shots of the device have now surfaced online. The Xiaomi 17 Ultra is rumored to offer a tripleâ€¦

items.title: The World Cup draw is here - this is how it will work
items.summary: Pots, quadrants, confederation constraints, group position grids ... the World Cup draw is not going to be straightforward.

items.title: Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold out for two months
items.summary: England defender Trent Alexanderâ€‘Arnold will be out for about two months after sustaining a thigh injury during Real Madrid's win over Athletic Club.

items.title: 'The best player I've ever played with' - Crawley 'chuffed' for Root
items.summary: Zak Crawley says he and his England teammates were "chuffed" after Joe Root scored his first century in Australia, finishing on 135 not out to help England close on 325-9 at stumps on day one of the second Ashes Test against Australia in Brisbane.

items.title: ASRock releases new Intel motherboard with support for both DDR4 and DDR5 memory â€” The "H610 Combo" features both types of DIMM slots, but you can't mix generations
items.summary: Amidst the never-ending cycle of DRAM shortage news cursing the industry, ASRock is finally bringing some good news: a motherboard with support for both DDR4 and DDR5 memory, that too in dual-channel mode. The H610M Combo doesn't have a price yet, but it looks like it can help somewhat mitigate theâ€¦

items.title: AMD isn't increasing prices on CPUs, at least for now â€” Ryzen appears to be safe from the AI hysteria
items.summary: Industry sources have told Tom's Hardware that there has been no communication from AMD about price hikes on Ryzen processors.

items.title: Woeful Wolves on course for lowest Christmas points tally
items.summary: Wolves' winless start to the season means they are on course for some unwanted records - including equalling the Premier League's lowest Christmas points tally.

items.title: Ex-Salford winger Caton-Brown bids for club
items.summary: Former Salford Red Devils winger Mason Caton-Brown launches a bid to take over the club as part of a consortium.

items.title: Norris 'not going to ask' Piastri for title help
items.summary: Lando Norris says he does not see a scenario where he would ask McLaren team-mate Oscar Piastri to let him past, in order for him to win the drivers' title.

items.title: Nvidia reinstates 32-bit PhysX support for RTX 50 series as part of its latest Game Ready driver rollout â€” 9 titles included in initial release
items.summary: After discontinuing the feature earlier this year, Nvidia is bringing back GPU-powered PhysX compatibility for the RTX 50 lineup.

items.title: When will England and Scotland find out where they will play World Cup matches?
items.summary: England and Scotland will know their World Cup opponents on Friday, but there will be a wait to discover where they will play.

items.title: Newegg's latest RAM bundle for $179 pairs 16GB of DDR5-6000 memory with an essentially free MSI B650 motherboard â€” offset astronomical price rises with limited-time bundled deals
items.summary: Pay $179 for 16GB of DDR5-6000 RAM and an MSI B650 motherboard bundle from Newegg, and save $129.

items.title: AMD raises Radeon RX 9000 GPU prices, increasing by $10 for every 8GB of VRAM â€” another price hike is also scheduled for January 2026
items.summary: An industry source has confirmed to Tom's Hardware that AMD has raised the price of its Radeon gaming graphics card by $10 per 8GB.

items.title: Root hits historic century but second Test finely balanced after day one
items.summary: Joe Root scores his first century in Australia and finishes unbeaten on 135 as England close on 325-9 at stumps on day one of the second Ashes Test against Australia in Brisbane.

items.title: Lyon feels 'filthy' after rare Test omission
items.summary: Nathan Lyon is left out of an Australia side for the first time in a home Test since 2012, while the hosts were also still without captain Pat Cummins for the second Ashes Test.

items.title: 'Australia will have to admit he's a great' - how Root hit elusive century
items.summary: Joe Root ends his long wait for a Test century in Australia by reaching three figures on day one of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: Opera for Android gets new AI upgrades
items.summary: Opera has announced new AI upgrades for its Android browser, Opera for Android, as it aims to bring its AI capabilities closer to those of its flagship desktop browser, dubbed Opera One. First is Ask AI, which gets a new access point for all AI queries in the browser. Just tap on the browser's searâ€¦
